messages.subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Help with a difficult mei
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, This mei can be read: Right side: Torishiro *TanTo Sha ni oite, Yoshida Katsunori saku. Tan (kitaeru-to forge)To (swords) Sha (workshop). Made by Yoshida
messages.messageBody:
Ron,
This mei can be read:
Right side: Torishiro *TanTo Sha ni oite, Yoshida Katsunori saku.
Tan (kitaeru-to forge)To (swords) Sha (workshop).
Made by Yoshida Katsunori at the Torishiro swordmaking workshop.

Left side:
Kiyomizu (can be read Shimizu)
or if it had a stroke over the Mizu character
obliterated by the mekugiana it would be read Kiyonaga.
Kiyomizu Toshio kun no tame ni.
Made for Mr. Toshio Kiyomizu.

Cary Condell

Condell & Co., Ltd.
P.O. Box 590115
San Francisco, CA 94159

Tel. 415-751-3784

condell@...
http://www.ikkyudo.com

messages.subject: Re: Help with a difficult mei
messages.msgSnippet: Torishiro Rento-sha (ni) oite Yoshida-Katsunori saku(tsukuru) (Tame) Shimizu toshio kun Katsunori-Yoshida made it at Torishro sword making factory/work shop
messages.messageBody:
Torishiro Rento-sha (ni) oite Yoshida-Katsunori saku(tsukuru)
(Tame) Shimizu toshio kun

Katsunori-Yoshida made it at Torishro sword making factory/work shop
For Mr. Toshio-Shimizu

Showa 19(1944) Feb. Lucky day.

I am watching this study group for one week.
Very interesting.
Best wishes from The Netherlands,

John Klein Nagelvoort

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Help with a difficult mei
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, I can tell you the  meaning ............. far left.............made for Kiyomitsu dadaddda ( the last kanji means Mr. ) to the right of that...........
messages.messageBody:
Ron,
I can tell you the " meaning ".............
far left.............made for Kiyomitsu dadaddda ( the last kanji means Mr. )
to the right of that........... at some location sword forging club lucky day
so und so made this.

I 'll let the others fill in the blank for you.

Milt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Help with a difficult mei
messages.msgSnippet: Fuller and Gregory list a Katsunori as working in Tottori region, but don t show an oshigata, so can t tell if it s the same guy. Jinsoo Seki smith page also
messages.messageBody:
Fuller and Gregory list a Katsunori as working in Tottori
region, but don't show an oshigata, so can't tell if it's
the same guy. Jinsoo "Seki smith" page also lists a Katsunori.

Rich S

messages.subject: Help with a difficult mei
messages.msgSnippet: I was wondering if someone could help me out with this mei: http://www.nihontophile.com/GendaiMei.jpg The date isn t a problem but the signature is giving me
messages.messageBody:
I was wondering if someone could help me out with this mei:
http://www.nihontophile.com/GendaiMei.jpg
The date isn't a problem but the signature is giving me fits.
It begins Oite and the maker is Katsunori (unknown Gendai smith?)
but while I can read a few of the other characters, I just cannot
put it together...

Thanks for the help!
Ron
